head.title: Coronavirus Information - Shelton School District

meta.content: The situation with the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) continues to change rapidly. We are committed to keeping you informed as we learn more about this illness and its impact on our schools and community. Shelton School District administration is coordinating with the Mason County Public Health Department on a regular basis to receive the most up-to-date information to best keep our schools safe.

nav.div: Shelton School District » News » What's New » Coronavirus Information

img.span:
The situation with the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) continues to change rapidly. We are committed to keeping you informed as we learn more about this illness and its impact on our schools and community. Shelton School District administration is coordinating with the Mason County Public Health Department on a regular basis to receive the most up-to-date information to best keep our schools safe.
We have set up a specific web page for coronavirus updates and resources and will be updating it daily/as needed as new information emerges. You can find this web page by CLICKING HERE or by clicking on the "Coronavirus Updates & Resources" link on the home page.

div.p: The Shelton School District does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following employee has been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination: Linda Arnold, Director of Human Resources. 360-426-1687. 700 S. 1st Street; Shelton, WA 98584. Complaint procedure can be found on this website under Board Policy #3210 (students) and #5010 (employees).

div.span: Website by SchoolMessenger Presence. © 2020 Intrado Corporation. All rights reserved.
